itemDescription: British association football player, born in September 1968

wikipedia_page.main:
Lee Brendan Martin (born 9 September 1968) is an English former professional footballer. He played as a goalkeeper for many teams in the north of England.
He graduated from the University of Salford's Physiotherapy degree in 2002  and was the physiotherapist at his home-town club, Huddersfield Town between 2003 and 2008. He left on 4 July 2008, "by mutual consent", to start up his own physiotherapy business. He was replaced at the Galpharm Stadium by the ex-Accrington Stanley physiotherapist Ian Liversedge.He was appointed as Physiotherapist by Tranmere Rovers in 2010.
